Content:: This article documents the chronology and epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 in July 2020, the virus which causes the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and is responsible for the COVID-19 pandemic. The first human cases of COVID-19 were identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. WHO Situation Report 163:[1] WHO Situation Report 164:[10] WHO Situation Report 165:[21] WHO Situation Report 166:[34] WHO Situation Report 167:[42] WHO Situation Report 168:[48] WHO Situation Report 169:[63] WHO Situation Report 170:[79] WHO Situation Report 171:[93] WHO Situation Report 172:[107] WHO Situation Report 173:[122] WHO Situation Report 174:[138] WHO Situation Report 175:[152] WHO Situation Report 176:[164] WHO Situation Report 177:[178] WHO Situation Report 178:[185] WHO Situation Report 179:[196] WHO Situation Report 180:[204] WHO Situation Report 181:[209] WHO Situation Report 182:[215] WHO Situation Report 183:[222] WHO Situation Report 184:[228] WHO Situation Report 185:[234] WHO Situation Report 186:[240] WHO Situation Report 187:[248] WHO Situation Report 188:[255] WHO Situation Report 189:[261] WHO Situation Report 190:[268] WHO Situation Report 191:[274] WHO Situation Report 192:[281] WHO Situation Report 193:[287] Countries and territories that confirmed their first cases during July 2020: By the end of July, only the following countries and territories have not reported any cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections: Africa Asia Europe Oceania
Title: Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in July 2020 - Wikipedia
